messages.content: do you know who Maximilien Robespierre was?

Yes, I do. Maximilien Robespierre was a French lawyer and politician who played a key role in the French Revolution. He was a member of the Committee of Public Safety and was responsible for the Reign of Terror, a period of violence during which many people were executed for being perceived as threats to the Revolution. Robespierre was eventually arrested and executed himself in 1794.

Jean-Paul Marat was a French political activist and journalist who lived during the French Revolution. He was a member of the radical Jacobin Club and used his newspaper, "L'Ami du peuple" (Friend of the people), to promote his political views. Marat was a strong advocate for the rights of the lower classes and supported the use of violence to achieve political goals. He was assassinated in his bathtub by Charlotte Corday, a Girondin sympathizer, in 1793.
